text: Many of us probably couldn’t identify this work of art, b there’s one person who definitely doesn’t have a clue wha even is, and that is... ... JESSE, who steps into the shot, his back to us. He lo at it, his head tilting a little left, a little right. Af a moment of silent contemplation...

Yo, I thought I was gonna see some, like, vaginas. He tells this to a YOUNG WOMAN, who steps into frame next him. A familiar silhouette against the lighted artwork, a we soon reveal this is... JANE. Yes, Jesse’s beautiful, dear, lost... dead Jane. Telling us this is another FLASHBACK, sometime after thei planned Santa Fe visit in Episode #209, but before their downward drug spiral of #211.
I didn’t say she actually painted vaginas. I said some of her paintings looked like vaginas.

(re: this painting) Uh, seriously? Not even close. Jane smiles at his playfulness. He’s just bored and wants get under her skin. But Jane still makes an effort to educate him, whispering respectfully in the museum...

Georgia O'Keeffe painted all kinds of stuff. Everyday items. Her surroundings. Some of it evoked an... erotic nature. It’s who she was. Jesse squints at the square black hole in the painting. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 2.
Not like any vagina I ever saw. (then) This chick have medical issues?
This particular painting is of a door. Jane pads off, leaving Jesse to stare at the abstract por He frowns, not convinced at all...

Any other doors here we can check out? Like, real ones, or...? INT. JESSE’S TERCEL - DAY - LATER The couple climb into Jesse’s Tercel, a lit CIGARETTE in Jane’s mouth. Jesse is still a little dumbfounded, holdin his keys in his hand.
Y'know, I-I-I don’t get it. Why would anyone paint a picture of a door? Over and over again, like dozens of times?
But it wasn’t the same...
Uh, yeah. It was.

It was the same subject, but it was different every time. The light was different, her mood was different. She saw something new each time she painted it. Jesse’s not buying into this artsy-fartsy bullshit.
And that’s not psycho to you.
Well, then... why should we do anything more than once? Should I just smoke this one cigarette? Maybe we should only have sex once if it’s the same thing. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 3.
This gets Jesse’s attention... Don't go down that road.
Whoa. No...

Should we just watch one sunset? Or live just one day? (her point) Because it’s new every time. Each time it’s a different experience. Jesse can’t argue with that -- but something is still rub him wrong about the whole thing. And besides, he’s having too much fun razzing her over this.
Okay, fine. I guess the cow skull pictures were cool, but... a DOOR? I will say it again. A door. ZZZZZZZZLZZLZAZLZZZ «we Jesse lets out a fake SNORE, but he still doesn’t get und her skin.

Why not a door? Sometimes you get fixated on something, and you might not even get why. You open yourself up and go with the flow... wherever the universe takes you. Jesse sighs, he’s not going to win this one. He puts his keys in the ignition and starts the car.
Okay, so... the universe took her to a door. She got all obsessed with it and just had to paint it twenty times until it was perfect. Jane shakes her head -- not quite.
No. I wouldn’t say that. Nothing’s perfect. Jesse studies her and smiles.
Yeah? Well, I mean... Some things. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 4.
Meaning her. Romantic Jesse shifts over and gives her a kiss. Jane intentionally (playfully) doesn’t lean in to m it easier for him to reach. She smiles as he moves back.
That was so sweet, I think I threw up in my mouth a little bit.
(laughs ) You can’t admit just for once that I'm right?! C’mon. That O'Keeffe lady kept trying over and over until that stupid door was perfect. Jane smokes her cigarette -- shakes her head.

No. That door... was her home, and she loved it. To me, that’s about making that feeling last. Jesse watches Jane take a final satisfying drag on her cigarette, the filter stained with lipstick, and... An ECU of the CIGARETTE being extinguished in Jesse’s ful ashtray. A remnant which we found last episode in #310, f a moment Jesse wishes would have gone on forever.
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 5.

A PAIR OF FEET. Wearing hospital booties, lowering toward the ground with a motorized HUMMMMMMM. The feet belong to HANK. He is strapped into something called an Electromechanical Patient Lifter, which has him in a diap like harness attached to motorized cables that raise and lower him. A PHYSICAL THERAPIST guides him between a set PARALLEL BARS. (This area should be filled with as much h end physical therapy equipment as we can get, probably in big redressed Waiting Room).

Okay, alright. Here we go. You ready? Sweat drips off Hank’s forehead as the weight shifts -- h feet touch the ground, but only his arm strength is supporting him. He’s clearly having trouble, his breathin is labored... his legs have no power; little movement. MARIE, SKYLER and WALTER JR. are here for moral support, to the side. Full of hope that he can do this, but... The pain is too much. He wants to stop.
C’mon, gimme a step. Gimme one step.
(struggling) Nope. Nope. That’s it. Take me up.
You can do this, Hank. (then) C'mon, it’s supposed to hurt. Pain is weakness leaving your body--
Pain is my foot in your ass, Marie. Marie is a bit of a drill instructor here, and doesn’t mi the abuse. Giving as good as she gets...
Hey, if you can get your leg up that high, I say go for it! (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 6.
Hank’s arms shake. He’s falling. He can’t do it.

Take me up, take me up! HUMMMMMMMM. The therapist slowly raises Hank back up, so feet are dangling a little. Marie remains strong, not giv away any hint of disappointment. But Skyler gives her son comforting rub on the back, knowing how important Uncle H is to Junior. The therapist remains positive...
Alright, coffee break. We're gonna let you rest for a minute, then we're gonna try it again.
Never mind about your “coffee break.” Take me up. I’m done.

We'll just pick up where we left off. Hank sees the concern and subtle pity on Sky and Junior's faces. It riles him even more. He looks at his wife... But Walt Jr. tries to encourage and urge him on... WALTER, JR. C'mon, Uncle Hank. You can do it. How else are you gonna get out of here? But something about this pisses Hank off even more. He lo in on Junior and snaps...

Don’t you have any friends? I mean, Jesus. Find something better to do! I don’t need everyone staring at me hangin’ here like a camel’s ball sac. Hank is a little mean and petty, but Junior isn’t hurt. H understands (going all the way back to the Pilot when it awkward for him just to try on new pants).
Hank, he just wants to be supportive-- But Walt Jr. softly interrupts his mom and aunt... (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 7.

It’s alright. Walt Jr. moves toward the exit. Both Skyler and Marie suppress the urge to lay into Hank, seeing him hanging th in his debilitated state. Hank knows he was out of line t and part of him is sorry, but another part just doesn’t g a shit.
I'll be right back, okay? Skyler and Marie quietly follow after Junior. As they’re leaving...
(to therapist) Gonna get me out of here sometime today? INT. HOSPITAL —- HALLWAY - DAY - CONTINUOUS Skyler turns back as hesitant Marie brings up what is, fo her, a delicate subject.
Sky? We got our first bill. And, you know, if you’re still insistent...
I am. Skyler holds out a hand -- let's have it. Marie reluctant produces a folded piece of paper, hands it over. It’s Han HOSPITAL/THERAPY BILL.
Prepare yourself. Skyler unfolds the bill and locates the “Amount Due”. We don’t see the total, but judging from Skyler’s reaction (underplayed for her sister’s benefit), it’s pretty damn

They're gonna start coming in weekly like that, so... (then) You're sure you can do this? Remember, this is the lie of “gambling winnings” Skyler t her sister in #309. It’s Skyler’s plan to take Walt’s dir drug money and use it for good. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 8.
Yeah... Skyler nods... but not a confident one, as the enormity o the situation hits her. Off her well-faked smile... AN ABSTRACT IMAGE. A wavy SEA OF BLUE. We are in...

We're looking straight up through a wavy, solid sheet of BLUE METH. It may take a beat to figure out where we are, but once Jesse’s FACE appears in his Tyvek suit, we'll probably know. He looks down through the “glass,” right at us, examining fine workmanship. After a few beats of us feeling like pe fish in his aquarium... Jesse raises a SCRAPER TOOL, and using the butt of it... SMASH!!! Meth spiders out into beautiful broken aqua shar SMASH-SMASH-SMASH as he then breaks it smaller and smalle

Jesse transfers the product into the usual Rubbermaid... as he works, he gets an odd feeling. He turns to see... WALT -- watching him closely. Very closely. Creepy, like Walt’s either going to kiss him or kill him. Okay... Jesse goes back to his task. He seals the lid and moves t LAST of FIVE BINS to the weigh station, but immediately, steps in.
I’1l do that.
What the hell, man? Jesse steps back, watching Walt zero out the scale and calculate the weight.
What, I can’t work a scale now? But Walt says nothing, recording the weight onto a chart. Jesse slow-burns, wanting to know what the deal is... (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 9.

This is bullshit. Just say it. Just say the words. You think I’m stealing?! Walt holds a finger to his lips -- shhhh. He motions arou to the rafters, as if to say, “Bugs. They (Gus and compan might be listening. Don’t use that word.” Walt returns hi attention back to the clipboard. Jesse just shakes his head, full of mock outrage. Of cour we know he’s stealing, but how dare this motherfucker acc him! Off of riled Jesse...
Establishing. Where Jesse attends his drug counselling. A yes, this maybe could be DUSK.
“Walk with who you are.”

Jesse slips into a session already in progress. An averag sized group, including BADGER and SKINNY PETE, in their r circle setting, listen to words of encouragement from the GROUP LEADER (last seen in #309).

That was the phrase my sponsor used with me, back when I first started coming to meetings. (scans faces) It’s probably just a different way of saying, “Be yourself.” Right? But this idea of “walk” also tells me that I have to move forward. Badger and Skinny Pete actually seem to be into this mess Listening carefully and nodding to these words of persona motivation. Are they just playing along? We’re not sure.
Always good advice, at least for me. (scans group) I see we have some new people here at Group. Couple of new faces. See some hands? First time? (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 10.
Four hands go up around the circle, hesitant and unsure, their first experience in group. One new girl, ANDREA (ea 20's, Latina) is the last to reluctantly raise her hand.

Great. Welcome. Maybe we can go around, introduce ourselves. Say whatever’s on your mind. (points) How about you? You want to start us off... He points to Andrea -- pretty, alone, fragile. Jesse take note of her when she’s called upon. She’s uncomfortable w all these new eyes on her, but she also has a toughness t finally gets her to, “Fuck it, I'll just do this...”
Yeah. My name is Andrea... and uh... Not really sure what else to say, she gives a brief shrug her shoulder. The Group Leader remains positive...
We don’t bite. No judgements. You can be as open and honest as you want to be.
Honestly. .? (then) I don’t want to be here. She’s not being bitchy, or a hard-ass. It’s simply that h asked, and she answered.
Alright, fair enough. Who else had their hand up? As our group leader continues on, unruffled, we hold on Jesse. Off him, eyeing Andrea...

CLOSE ON doughnuts being picked over. It’s after the meeting, and group members gather around the free coffee snacks at a side table. Badger loads up as Jesse approach him and Skinny Pete, pretending not to know them (as “cov in their meth selling ruse). (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 11.
Hey. ‘Sup. My name’s Jesse.
Well... hello, Jesse. My name is Brandon. And this is, I believe... Peter?
Right. I’m Peter. How are you? Jesse rolls his eyes at their suck-ass acting. He looks around, walking them out of earshot of the rest of the gr

I just, uh, wanted to give you a heads up. It’s gonna get a little slower smuggling product with, uh, Grandpa Anus watching every move I make. (assures them) Don’t worry. I’11l keep it flowing. Badger and Skinny Pete don’t show relief or enthusiasm ov this news, just an awkward sideways glance.
(faking it) Great... Right on.
Yeah.
(glances around) So, uh... how’zit selling? Mad volume? The guys look at each other and kind of nod, slowly worki their way down to...
Yeah, it’s uh... you know, uh... (finally) It’s not so good. it’s
What do you mean? you sold? How much have
I sold a teenth. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 12.
One teenth?! That’s it? (glances around at group) To who? Badger points meekly to Skinny Pete.
To him. Pete shrugs sheepishly, gives a little “Yo”-type nod and wave. Jesse is stunned -- you've gotta be fucking kidding
Look, it’s not so easy selling to these people. They’re here tryin’ to better themselves.
Yeah, there’s like... positivity and stuff goin’ on here. Jesse is outraged. He wants to bust a gasket and yell, bu he can’t do it here. Instead, quietly:
I’m out risking my ass to get product for you two, and you’re too pussy to sell?! You’re pathetic. (fuming) Y'know what? I want it back. All of it. I’11 sell it myself!
C'mon, man. Don’t be like that. Selling to these people... It’s like shooting a baby in the face. It’s not natural.
Yeah, Jesse. It’s not so easy like you think.

I will show you exactly how easy it is... Jesse turns and looks around the room, until his eyes lan on... ANDREA -- who is having her court card signed by the Grou Leader. He’s giving some last words of advice to a few of the newbies -- stick with this, it's worth trying. But Andrea is waiting to get her card back and split. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 13.

Jesse gives a last look back to his worthless salesmen, a starts heading toward the exit. Just as... Andrea gets her signed card back, also making her way tow the door. Jesse watches her as she moves -- a lion tracking the wea prey in the herd. Jesse times his arrival at the door just ahead of Andrea. About to exit, he pauses and smiles, moving as if to say, “Ladies first.”
Oh, hey. Sorry...
No. Go ahead. But Jesse doesn’t go -- he’s much too sensitive a guy to ahead of a woman. Smooth, sweet, and to us... just evil.
Andrea, right?
Yeah.

Hey. Um, my name’s Jesse, and, uh... (private -- for them only) I don’t really want to be here either. (beat) Oh, uh... Sorry... Off Andrea, heartened to meet someone who thinks like she does, and no idea of what awaits her...
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 14.

BLACKNESS. An unknown RUMBLE sound, muffled, like we’re underwater. And it turns out, yes, we are underwater, as lid comes off a metal pot -- we’re LOOKING UP from the bo through boiling water. Not in the Super Lab, but...

Skyler moves into view above us, her face looking down as salts the water. After a beat, she dumps in a fistful of pasta -- SPLOOSH! WIDER -- out of our specialty shot -- we see Skyler also a pot of sauce and meatballs bubbling, a bowl of salad, a loaf of Italian bread on a cutting board. She cranks a cooking timer as through the main room walks... ... Walter Jr. He eyes the dining room table, seeing ther THREE PLACE SETTINGS. WALTER, JR. Aunt Marie’s coming to dinner? Skyler wipes her hands with a towel, answering with caref measured nonchalance:
No. Your Dad is. Really? Off Junior, smiling at this unexpected surprise..

Two hours later. Empty sauce-smeared plates tell us that dinner is well over, as we find Walt in his old chair wit baby Holly cradled against his body. WALTER, JR. (playfully) How'd you get her to sleep so quick? Are you that boring?

I'm “comforting.” I’m a comforting presence. As Walt rises to place sleeping Holly in her nearby bassi he shoots a smile to Skyler, who sits nursing a glass of wine. Sky is politely noncommittal. Just... even. But if we're judging by Junior’s mood, the meal went well. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 15.

Walt, Jr. reaches in his wallet, pulls out his INSTRUCTIO PERMIT from the New Mexico DMV and holds it up for his fo to see (we do NOT need to show it particularly well -- we especially DON’T want to make out the date and year). WALTER, JR. Hey, so check it out. See what this means? Check out the date. Next Thursday is officially six months that I’ve had my learner's. Which means... (hooray!) «+. I can get my provisional and start driving by myself.

(returning to the table) Since when? You don’t turn sixteen for two more months. WALTER, JR. Doesn’t matter -- it’s a provisional. Look it up! They changed the law like, ten years ago. Walt looks to Skyler -- you onboard with this? She alread knew, and shrugs -- yep.
Well, I didn’t vote for that. WALTER, JR. Doesn’t matter if you voted for it. It’s the law. (again playful) So both of you start thinking about what kinda car you wanna buy me.
Mmm. WALTER, JR. I think I’d be good with either an old IROC or a ‘Stang.
Ah. A “'Stang,” mm-hmm?
How about something with playing cards in the spokes? Makes a nice motor-y sound. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 16.

This is refreshing -- Mom and Dad together goofing around with Junior. It’s been a long time since we’ve seen that. Walter, Jr.'s been kinda starved for it, in fact. Grinnin WALTER, JR. Ha, ha dad. You're not going to get off that easy. Alas, all good things end. At this lull in the conversati

Well, I think this is um... we should probably table this discussion for later. Your Dad and I have a couple things to talk about, so... Junior sighs. He gets up, gathering his crutches and head to his room. WALTER, JR. Okay. A 1971 Mach 1 fastback in Grabber Lime... with a shaker hood... ‘Stang.
I’ll write that down so we don’t forget. (fake-pats his chest) A darn. No pencil. Mom and Dad smile as their son exits... but then they mak eye contact with each other. Walt’s here for other busine

Reaching in a pocket of his own nearby jacket, Walt offer Skyler a plain white, unmarked ENVELOPE (unsealed). Skyle nervously nods thanks. Here’s the moment of truth. She opens the envelope and slides out a CASHIER'S CHECK ( won't see the amount, but just in case, it’s $10,000). Skyler examines the check a moment, grateful, but then... curious. Confused. She finally has to break the silence.
What is “Ice Station Zebra Associates?” Walt wasn’t expecting questions, so he’s a little thrown. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 17.
It’s a loan-out. It’s fine.
Whose loan-out?
It’s fine. Really. I have a guy. Hmm. Skyler’s radar is now WAY up.
Ohhh-kay... um, does your “guy” know the tax code and regulations for New Mexico? Cause, there’s very specific paperwork that has to be submitted quarterly on this.
(nodding; absolutely!) Yes. My guy is a TOP guy...
Who is he? What’s his name? What are his qualifications? Walt, this... (lowers her voice) «+. money has to be unimpeachable when it reaches Hank and Marie.
And it is. It will be.
But, how do I know that? I mean, apparently you can’t even tell me the man’s name. Exasperated, Walt thinks he can call her bluff.
Jesus, Skyler. You really want to know? I mean, d’you you really want to know?! Really? Big mistake. Off Skyler’s resolute face -- Absolutely.

BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 18. INT. SAUL’S OFFICE - LOBBY - DAY In a snazzy ONE-ER, we PAN ACROSS a thicket of gang-bange cheats and troglodytes who are waiting for the legal serv of Mr. Saul Goodman, Esq. to find... .»». Walt and Skyler. Skyler is in a slight state of shoc even she didn’t expect it to be this bad. Off Walt, watch her closely out of the corner of his eye... realizing a b too late that this is probably a HUGE mistake... INT. SAUL’S OFFICE - DAY - LATER CLOSE ON Saul’s “University of American Samoa” diploma. Skyler stands staring at it, deadpan and unimpressed. Beh her we find SAUL GOODMAN, definitely impressed (and sligh flummoxed) to be meeting pretty Skyler.

Hell. Welcome. What a pleasure it is to have you! I’m just gonna call you Skyler, if that’s okay. It’s a lovely name. Reminds me of a... big beautiful sky. Walt never told me lucky how lucky he was... prior to recent unfortunate events. Walt watches nervously as his two worlds collide -- Saul fawning over the tall-drink-of-water that is Skyler, and Skyler uneasy that she might accidentally pick up a socia disease from the charged and shifty shyster that is Saul.

Clearly his taste in women is the same as his taste in lawyers: only very best with just the right amount of dirty. (laughs; off her stare) That’s a joke. That’s a joke. It’s funny because you are so clearly very classy. Here, please, sit down. Saul pulls out a chair for her. When she’s not looking, S gives a quick eyebrow-raise of approval to Walt for landi such a looker. Walt tries not to notice, taking his own s as Saul rounds to the business side of his desk.
So. Walt tells me that you have, uh, some concerns I can alleviate. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 19.
As Skyler scans the big “Constitution wall” behind Saul..
Uh, yes I do. I have... concerns. No shit. Glancing sidelong at Walt, you don’t have to be Kreskin to read her mind. How the fuck did you end up wit THIS guy? Yet Skyler politely presses forward...
Um, if we’re going to go down this road... and clearly we are, for the sake of my brother-in-law...
I’ve heard about him. Uh, he’s an American hero. Nodding, Saul gives out with the cheesy sympathy like a discount undertaker. Skyler pauses flatly, then continues
At any rate, I need some assurances that we’re gonna go about this ina manner that is extremely safe and cautious.
Fair enough. I'’11 walk you through the process. First step is something we like to call “money laundering.” Alright, take you’re money were represented by say... these jelly beans.
Uh, Saul... Saul sets out a jar of jelly beans, meaning to pitch the simplistic “Money Laundering 101” he gave to Jesse in #30 Walt tries to warn Saul with a quick shake of his head.
Y'know, I’m a bookkeeper -- so I actually, I know what money laundering is.
Uh-huh. (takes away jelly beans) Well. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 20.
Really? Crickets.
And as with most things, the Devil is in the details. So to begin with, what are we saying is the source of this money?
That's simple. Walt here came up with a great story about gambling winnings. Blackjack, right? Some card-counting system?
(quiet discomfort) Um, actually that was Skyler’s idea. Saul’s eyes widen at Skyler, impressed.

Well. You grow more gorgeous by the minute! (then; shrugs) Well, there you have it. I/’11 generate false Currency Transaction Reports out the wazoo, as well as the necessary W-2Gs. I know a couple casino managers who will jump at the chance to report false losses. So, win-win for everyone.
But you can’t sell that for very long --
(interrupts) Yeah, yeah. Way ahead of you. Uh, we declare just enough so as not to arouse suspicion. Then, Walt’s one- time winnings become seed money for investment.
Investment in what?
Drum roll please... wait for it... (beaming) Laser Tag. Off their non-reaction: (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 21.
Laser Tag! Seven thousand square feet of rollicking fun in the heart of northern Bernalillo County! Skyler is stone-faced.
Laser Tag.
Yeah. There’s guns and glo-lites, and kids wear the vests and runa round in teams--

(interrupts) Yeah, I actually know what it is. It just that... in relation to Walt, it’s, I mean, it doesn’t make any sense. Walt is a silent, sick observer as these two go at it. Saul’s patience rapidly frays as she questions his method Trying to sound like he’s joking:
Makes more sense than you two being together! I’m still trying to figure out how that happened...
Do you even know Walt? I mean, how would he, of all people, buy a Laser Tag business? It-it doesn’t add up.
It adds up perfectly. Walt’s a scientist. Scientists love lasers! Skyler stares at him flatly. The wind leaves Saul’
Plus, they got bumper boats. So.

“Hey everybody, Walt suddenly decided to invest in laser tag! Just out of the blue!” Really? That’s what we’re supposed to tell people -- our family, our friends... the government... s sails. (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 22.

Okay. Let me bottom line this for you. You don’t need to be involved. Okay? Because I’ve been doing this for a lot of years, successfully -- believe it or not, without your help! (smiles) So. Thank you for stopping by. Saul is done. Skyler stares at him -- they’re at stalemat Off Walt, not wanting to make a move to remind either of that he’s sitting there... EXT. ANDREA’S HOME - DAY Establishing. A small house somewhere in the barrio. INT. ANDREA’S HOME - DAY Andrea's face appears near a lamp in her living room, reaching under to feel for the switch. She clicks off the light, leaving only the sun sneaking through the drawn curtains. Andrea plops on the couch next to... Jesse. And the two start making out. Damn, our boy works fast -- he is in! As Jesse starts moving a little too fas unbuttoning her shirt...
You want a beer or somethin’?
(smiles) Or somethin’? What do you mean? Jesse kisses her neck as she laughs.
Like beer. I’m cleaned out of anything else. Even if I wasn’t, we're not supposed to.

Yeah. I’ve heard it... over and over and over again. Y'know, don’t you think it’s ridiculous that society says beer is okay, anda little hit of something... sweet is wrong? She keeps gently kissing him, but he keeps selling... (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 23.
I mean, mhat’s the point of shutting yourself off completely from something that... lifts you off the ground? I spend so much energy fighting the urge not to use, and I feel like crap ‘cause of it...
I know. It’s just...
What?

I can’t get caught using again. Jesse looks her in the eyes. Something painful behind the For a moment, it seems as if Jesse is going to soften... Maybe it's not easy to do this, like the guys said. Then:

The thing is... not to get caught. (then) You ever try that blue stuff that’s going around? Just a little gas in the tank and... suddenly everything is interesting. (half to himself) Man. I wish I could make that feeling last. Jesse is smooth in his seduction... and evil... as he bui up the desire for meth, tempting Andrea with each word.
Like I said. I got nothing here. Jesse nods, waiting for the right moment to say...

What if I could get some? Andrea seems open to it. Yes. What if? But before Jesse can close the deal... The front door OPENS. A FIVE-YEAR OLD BOY runs in, follow by Andrea’s GRANDMA (50s), who carries two bags of grocer
Mommy! Mommy! (CONTINUED)
BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 24.
Jesse and Andrea quickly compose themselves as the boy, Andrea’s son BROCK, runs to her.
Hey, baby. Your nana brought you home early. (to grandma) Grandma, I thought you were keeping Brock today? Grandma eyes Jesse, not too pleased.
I was, then I saw your car. I thought you had a meeting.

I did, but we changed the time. (points to Jesse) Grandma, this is Jesse. He’s from the meeting. He’s like a sponsor. Jesse, this is Grandma. Jesse gives a half-hearted, uncomfortable nod and wave. Grandma sets down the groceries and leaves, muttering disparaging words in Spanish.
(in Spanish) I'm tired... tired of you all. SLAM goes the door. Jesse adjusts in his seat to see... Brock at the edge of the couch, staring at him.
(feeling awkward now) Jesse, this is Brock. Andrea gathers the groceries and carries them into the adjacent kitchen, putting them away. Brock, a cute kid, keeps staring at Jesse.
(to Andrea) So... you, uh, you have a kid, huh? She nods. Jesse and the boy stare at each other a moment, and a softer side of Jesse, the old Jesse, seems to come
‘Sup? Brock, huh. That’s a cool name. Here. Give it up... (CONTINUED)

Put that away, man! Jesse is clearly playing this as if h were a naive white guy buying drugs in the barrio. Tomas now NODS to a distant, familiar CAR parked around a corner. Which noses into view. It slowly motors our way. It pulls up alongside Jesse, who does his best to look nervous (alright, maybe it’s not all an act). Inside the muscle car are two familiar BULLETHEADS -- the dealers wh ordered Tomas to kill Combo.

Hey, ‘sup. One of the Bulletheads shuts him down with a LOOK. Then t thug gives a quick “hand it over” flick-flick of his fing Jesse nods, counts out two hundred and hands it over. The guy takes it, counts, glances to Tomas... and then th two Bulletheads drive off. They round right back to their opposite corner, the one they were parked on originally. Jesse blinks -- where's my dope, yo?!

Hey! Yo! Jesse glances back at Tomas behind him... who unceremonio shoves a TEENTH BAGGIE in Jesse’s hand. This is the set-u apparently: the two Bulletheads hold the money while the underage kid holds the METH. If he gets busted, he’s only minor, while the two hardass creeps in the car likely ska His purchase gripped in hand, Jesse hesitates, staring do at young Tomas. The kid frowns up at him.

Bounce. Jesse does as he’s told -- for the moment. He turns and walks back toward his parked Tercel. We PULL Jesse along, letting Tomas recede deeper and deep into b.g. As we stay here on Jesse, Steadicamming him along... ... His expression DARKENS. To a cold place we’ve never quite seen before. As we desperately wonder what our Jess is thinking... and planning...
